results.title: Soil
results.creator_credit: Robin Wischusen, ABC-TV (Australia) and Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
A plant must absorb essential nutrients from the soil and how a plant utilises essential nutrients and trace elements through the fixed, exchangeable and soluble nutrient pools is shown. The Nitrogen cycle is also explained. Roots absorb soil nutrients and depending on whether there is an excess or defecit of nitrogen, the soil is either acidic or alkaline. Soil texture is explained and the modern day use of hydroponics.

results.brief_description: Takes up the fundamental softball skills of throwing, catching, batting and fielding as they apply during the last inning of a girl’s intramural game. Each player’s individual skill and coordinated team play is pointed out.

results.title: Soft hands = El Aydi el naema
results.creator_credit: Mahmoud Zulfikar and General Company for Arabic Film Production
results.brief_description: Romantic comedy starring Sabah, one of the Middle East’s most popular singers of the 50’s - 70’s. Following the Egyptian revolution, Prince Chawkat resides in his palace, desperately trying to avoid destitution. As he tries to manage his domestic finances, his debts mount, forcing his family to make ends meet. Prince Chawkat must learn to earn his own living rather than rely on his inheritance. His daughters Jihan and Myrva try to assist him, but his pride constantly intervenes. When the Prince falls in love with a young woman, played by Sabah, he finds that he must learn humility before he can earn her love. Prince Chawkat’s journey reflects the message of Nasser’s ‘New Egypt’, creating its own opportunities and relying on its own resources rather than looking towards Europe for economic harmony. The film promotes that a man can create a destiny that culminates in a harmonious marriage and family life, through study and hard work. Sabah sings Houb al Khatf (Secret Love) and Beh Fatha Ba.

results.title: Socialisation: the Dragon School, Oxford (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Argent, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personality and Learning”.
Looks at the process of socialisation in the Dragon school, an Oxford preparatory school of some 600 pupils, mostly boys, but with 24 girls. Illustrates some of the values of the school, different teaching approaches and the attitude explicit and implicit to social control.

results.title: Social psychology
results.creator_credit: Leslie Hill and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 24 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Human beings are social animals. We live in groups and are influenced by others. Social psychology is interested in how people affect each other, in the individual in the context of the group. In particular the program looks at how stereotyping allows us to make immediate, albeit rough, assumptions about how a person may behave so that we may react appropriately. However the same process of stereotyping can lead to prejudice and bias which may in turn lead to small or large scale conflict.

results.title: Social development
results.creator_credit: Neil Howe, Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Australia has accepted the responsibility of training and assisting the people of Papua and New Guinea who are on the threshold of a more complex way of life. Education at the primary level for some is being established. Health services include the provision of hospitals and doctors and the training of young men and women to teach sanitation and hygiene. Religious teaching is undertaken by Missions, and European sports and pastimes are taking the place of tribal feasts.
